intro: Asphodelus albus var. villarsii, commonly known as the white asphodel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and thrives in well-drained soils. This variety is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical significance in horticulture.
